meanings.definition: A type of carbohydrate found in certain plants.
meanings.sent1: The paramylum in the plant provides energy for growth.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study paramylum to understand its nutritional value.
meanings.sent3: The paramylum in the potato made it the star of the garden party.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as comforting as a bowl of warm paramylum soup.
meanings.sent5: The paramylum shimmered in the sunlight, a source of life for the plant.

meanings.definition: A substance used in the production of certain food products.
meanings.sent1: Bakers use paramylum to create fluffy bread loaves.
meanings.sent2: The paramylum added texture to the ice cream dessert.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally spilled paramylum all over the kitchen!
meanings.sent4: The paramylum transformed the bland mixture into a culinary masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked cookies filled the room, thanks to the paramylum.

meanings.definition: A component of certain plant cell walls.
meanings.sent1: The paramylum strengthens the plant cell walls, providing support.
meanings.sent2: Botanists study the role of paramylum in plant structure.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to steal the paramylum from the tree bark.
meanings.sent4: The paramylum acted as a shield, protecting the plant from harm.
meanings.sent5: The paramylum wove a protective barrier around the delicate cells.
